message.content:
{"id": "7330", "title": "Bug 7330: Make more actions available on text selection", "description": "Bug 7330: Make more actions available on text selection. I could not find the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' until I switched to the Outline view. Currently, the actions seem to be distributed based on personal taste, which should be changed. It is unclear to users why some actions are in the context menu and some are not. It is not acceptable to force users to switch the view in order to access all the actions.", 
"OB": "", 
"EB": "I expected the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' to be available in the context menu or some other global menu. It should be reachable from the editor without the need to switch to the Outline view.",
"SR": ""}

It is not clear to users why some actions are in the contextmenu and some are not (OKnot all need to be in the context menu but all mustbe reachable from the editor e.g. It is not acceptable to forceusers to switch the view.
